message.content:
cs.NE, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper presents a closed loop neuromorphic decoder chip-driven intra-cortical brain machine interface (iBMI) in a non-human primate (NHP) based experimental setup. The paper involves the use of neural networks and machine learning algorithms for real-time decoding of neural signals. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also involves robotics and control systems for the closed loop system, which suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.RO (Robotics). The use of machine learning algorithms and neural networks also suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper involves the use of image processing techniques for decoding neural signals, which suggests the possibility of it belonging to cs.CV (Computer Vision).
